ANU.name: Camille Goodman
interest: Public international law, law of the sea, international fisheries law, public policy
ANU.biography: In 2020, Camille has been appointed as a Visiting Fellow at the ANU Centre for International and Public Law, where she will pursue her research interests in the international law of the sea. Camille is an active member of the Australian and New Zealand Society of International Law (ANZSIL) (https://www.anzsil.org.au/). She serves as a member of the ANZSIL Council, and is Co-Chair of the Oceans and International Environmental Law Interest Group.

publication.title: Rights, Obligations, Prohibitions: A Practical Guide to Understanding Judicial Decisions on Coastal State Jurisdiction over Living Resources in the Exclusive Economic Zone
publication.source: The International Journal of Marine and Coastal Law, vol. 33, no. 3, pp. 558-584

publication.title: Law Beyond Boundaries: innovative mechanisms for the integrated management of biodiversity beyond national jurisdiction Introduction

publication.title: ustralian Jurisdiction and International Law
publication.source: in Donald R Rothwell & Emily Crawford (ed.), International Law in Australia, Thomson Reuters (Professional) Australia Limited, Sydney: Pyrmont, N.S.W., pp. 71-94pp

publication.title: Striking the right balance? Applying the jurisprudence of international tribunals to coastal state innovations in international fisheries governance
